info.title: Properties
info.description: All HubSpot objects store data in default and custom properties. These endpoints provide access to read and modify object properties in HubSpot.

get.description: Read all existing properties for the specified object type and HubSpot account.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create and return a copy of a new property for the specified object type.
Archive a provided list of properties. This method will return a 204 No Content response on success regardless of the initial state of the property (e.g. active, already archived, non-existent).
Create a batch of properties using the same rules as when creating an individual property.
Read a provided list of properties.

get.description: Read all existing property groups for the specified object type and HubSpot account.

post.description: Create and return a copy of a new property group.

get.description: Read a property group identified by {groupName}.

delete.description: Move a property group identified by {groupName} to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of a property group identified by {groupName}. Provided fields will be overwritten.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

delete.description: Move a property identified by {propertyName} to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of a property identified by {propertyName}. Provided fields will be overwritten.

name.description: The name of the property to read or modify.
The internal property group name, which must be used when referencing the property group via the API.

label.description: A human-readable label that will be shown in HubSpot.

displayOrder.description: Property groups are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property group to be displayed after any positive values.

PropertyGroup.description: An ID for a group of properties

name.description: The internal property name, which must be used when referencing the property via the API.

label.description: A human-readable property label that will be shown in HubSpot.

type.description: The data type of the property.

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.

groupName.description: The name of the property group the property belongs to.

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

options.description: A list of valid options for the property. This field is required for enumerated properties.

displayOrder.description: Properties are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property to be displayed after any positive values.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether or not the property's value must be unique. Once set, this can't be changed.

hidden.description: If true, the property won't be visible and can't be used in HubSpot.

formField.description: Whether or not the property can be used in a HubSpot form.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

value.description: The internal value of the option, which must be used when setting the property value through the API.

displayOrder.description: Options are shown in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

label.description: A human-readable property label that will be shown in HubSpot.

type.description: The data type of the property.

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.

groupName.description: The name of the property group the property belongs to.

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

options.description: A list of valid options for the property.

displayOrder.description: Properties are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the Property to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: If true, the property won't be visible and can't be used in HubSpot.

formField.description: Whether or not the property can be used in a HubSpot form.

name.description: The internal property group name, which must be used when referencing the property group via the API.

label.description: A human-readable label that will be shown in HubSpot.

displayOrder.description: Property groups are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property group to be displayed after any positive values.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

value.description: The internal value of the option, which must be used when setting the property value through the API.

displayOrder.description: Options are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: Hidden options will not be displayed in HubSpot.

label.description: A human-readable label that will be shown in HubSpot.

displayOrder.description: Property groups are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property group to be displayed after any positive values.

name.description: The internal property name, which must be used when referencing the property via the API.

label.description: A human-readable property label that will be shown in HubSpot.

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

groupName.description: The name of the property group the property belongs to.

options.description: A list of valid options for the property. This field is required for enumerated properties, but will be empty for other property types.

createdUserId.description: The internal user ID of the user who created the property in HubSpot. This field may not exist if the property was created outside of HubSpot.

updatedUserId.description: The internal user ID of the user who updated the property in HubSpot. This field may not exist if the property was updated outside of HubSpot.

referencedObjectType.description: If this property is related to other object(s), they'll be listed here.

displayOrder.description: Properties are shown in order, starting with the lowest positive integer value.

calculated.description: For default properties, true indicates that the property is calculated by a HubSpot process. It has no effect for custom properties.

externalOptions.description: For default properties, true indicates that the options are stored externally to the property settings.

archived.description: Whether or not the property is archived.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether or not the property's value must be unique. Once set, this can't be changed.

hidden.description: Whether or not the property will be hidden from the HubSpot UI. It's recommended this be set to false for custom properties.

hubspotDefined.description: This will be true for default object properties built into HubSpot.

showCurrencySymbol.description: Whether or not the property will display the currency symbol set in the account settings.

formField.description: Whether or not the property can be used in a HubSpot form.

scopes.contacts: Read from and write to my Contacts
